autumn.util

Class Reflect

  • java.lang.Object
    • autumn.util.Reflect

  • public final class Reflect
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides static utility methods for working with reflection.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      Reflect()

    • Method Detail

      • getConstructor

        public static java.lang.reflect.Field getConstructor(java.lang.Class owner,
                                     java.lang.String name)
                                              throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        This method searches for a field in a class object.
        Parameters:
        owner - is the class object to search.
        name - is the name of the field to search for.
        Returns:
        the found field.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - if the method could not be found.

      • getConstructor

        public static java.lang.reflect.Constructor getConstructor(java.lang.Class owner,
                                           java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Class> parameters)
                                                    throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
        This method searches for a constructor in a class object.
        Parameters:
        owner - is the class object to search.
        parameters - are the types of the constructor's formal parameters.
        Returns:
        the found constructor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if the constructor could not be found.

      • getMethod

        public static java.lang.reflect.Method getMethod(java.lang.Class owner,
                                 java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Class> parameters)
                                          throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
        This method searches for a method in a class object.
        Parameters:
        owner - is the class object to search.
        name - is the name of the method to search for.
        parameters - are the types of the method's formal parameters.
        Returns:
        the found method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if the method could not be found.

      • descriptorOf

        public static java.lang.String descriptorOf(java.lang.Class klass)
        This method computes the descriptor of a given type.
        Parameters:
        klass - is the class object that represents the type.
        Returns:
        the descriptor of the type.

      • descriptorOf

        public static java.lang.String descriptorOf(java.lang.reflect.Constructor ctor)
        This method computes the descriptor of a constructor.
        Parameters:
        ctor - is the constructor whose descriptor will be computed.
        Returns:
        the descriptor of the given constructor.

      • descriptorOf

        public static java.lang.String descriptorOf(java.lang.reflect.Method method)
        This method computes the descriptor of a method.
        Parameters:
        method - is the method whose descriptor will be computed.
        Returns:
        the descriptor of the given method.

      • isSubtypeOf

        public static boolean isSubtypeOf(java.lang.Class subtype,
                  java.lang.Class supertype)
        This method determines whether one type is a subtype of another.
        Parameters:
        subtype - is a possible subtype of the supertype.
        supertype - is a possible supertype of the subtype.
        Returns:
        true, iff subtype is really a subtype of the supertype.

      • isAssignableTo

        public static boolean isAssignableTo(java.lang.Class value,
                     java.lang.Class target)
        This method determines whether one type is assignable to another type.

        This method makes its determination based on the rules of the Autumn programming language. Remember, Autumn's rules differ from Java's rules.

        Parameters:
        value - is the type that may be assignable-to the target type.
        type - is the type that the value type may be assignable to.
        Returns:
        true, iff the value type is assignable-to the target type.
